intro: Otopappus perymenioides, commonly known as the desert pappus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves and a tall, slender stem that bears the inflorescence. The species is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these environments.
